original_table_html:
FIGURE 12-4
Disadvantages of Brand Extension
• Can confuse or frustrate consumers
• Can encounter retailer resistance
• Can fail and hurt parent brand image
• Can succeed but cannibalize sales of parent brand
• Can succeed but diminish identification with any one category
• Can succeed but hurt the image of parent brand
• Can dilute brand meaning
• Can cause the company to forgo the chance to develop a new brand
summary_markdown: Figure 12-4 outlines the potential disadvantages associated with brand extension. These drawbacks can manifest in several ways, including consumer confusion or frustration, and retailer resistance. Furthermore, brand extensions carry the risk of failure, which can negatively impact the parent brand's image. Even successful extensions can lead to unintended consequences such as cannibalizing sales of the parent brand, diminishing the brand's identification with a specific category, or diluting the overall brand meaning. Finally, pursuing brand extensions might cause a company to miss opportunities for developing entirely new brands.
